value.title: Introduction to Microsoft Power Platform
value.excerpt: Introduction to Microsoft Power Platform

value.title: Dynamic Power BI reports using Parameters
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how you can use a parameter, within a Power BI report, to dynamically change the data in a report. This uses M Functions within Power Query and a second source that has the key values to pull. Then using a gateway to enable refresh.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/iiNDq2VrZPY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Apps for multiple audiences has arrived!
value.excerpt: This has been a feature that has been asked for long time! The ability to control who can see what content within a published Power BI App! You can now serve up multiple audiences within a single app.  Announcing Public Preview of Multiple Audiences for Power BI Apps https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/announcing-public-preview-of-multiple-audiences-for-power-bi-apps/

value.title: How to Export Power BI To Excel (5 Different Ways)
value.excerpt: I'll show you 5 different ways to export  Power BI data to excel. value.title: Showing actuals and forecasts in the same chart with Power BI
value.excerpt: In budgeting reports, a common requirement is to show future sales forecast and actual sales volume on the same line chart. Learn how to achieve this goal using DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/73386?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:

value.title: Using the SELECTEDVALUE function in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how the SELECTEDVALUE DAX function simplifies the syntax required in many scenarios where you need to read a single value selected in the filter context.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/53917?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Power BI Bookmarks, Selections and Toggles
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can use bookmarks and selections to create interesting reports to show different aspects of your data. He also shows a very cool way to change between those selections that he picked up from one of his customers.  Bookmarks - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-desktop-bookmarks/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/_Afcj8mT5_Q" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI date table: create using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how to create a Power BI date table using DAX. The end result uses a combination of the GENERATE(), ROW() and CALENDARAUTO() DAX functions to create a calculated table resulting in a Power BI date table.  Using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS in DAX https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/using-generate-and-row-instead-of-addcolumns-in-dax/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gyvhM5eiT0U" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI on a Mac?
value.excerpt: Want to run Power BI on a mac? We look at what your options are to get Power BI Desktop running on your mac. You have a few choices.  Ideas: Power BI Designer for Mac https://ideas.powerbi.com/forums/265200-power-bi-ideas/suggestions/7546645-power-bi-designer-for-mac   Apple Boot Camp https://support.apple.com/boot-camp

value.title: Scope report design requirements
value.excerpt: Gathering appropriate inputs to scope your report design requirements involves identifying your audience, determining the suitable report types, and defining their interface and experience requirements. This module provides you with a strong foundation on which to learn how to plan your report design requirements.

value.title: Create a Popup Window in Power BI
value.excerpt: Wondering how Patrick created a popup video in a previous video? Well, here you go! Learn how you can create a popup experience to provide more information in your Power BI report.  Bookmarks Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLv2BtOtLblH1IJqcqSuMTyvEi7W-laWti  ðŸ“¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day - 03: Power BI Reporting - Part 2
value.excerpt: In this video, we demonstrate viewing two reports, one a Power BI report, and the other a paginated report.  The Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day online course aims to empower you as a report author with the technical knowledge required to create, publish, and distribute Power BI paginated reports.

value.title: How to filter a table to show only most recent date by group in Power Query
value.excerpt: It is a best practice to load in Power Bi only the data that you need. In today's video, I will show you how you can filter a table by the last date available.   Chapters: 00:00 Intro 00:30 Explain the use case 01:00 The solution Done!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: 2 ways to reduce your Power BI dataset size and speed up refresh
value.excerpt: Adam shows you two things to reduce your Power BI dataset size. These are both things he commonly sees with Power BI reports and could potentially save you a lot of space and improve refresh times along with report performance.  Data reduction techniques for import modeling: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/import-modeling-data-reduction

value.title: 20 tricks to finally master the Matrix visualization in Power BI!!
value.excerpt: The matrix visualization has over 100 configuration options, and some of the most basic functionality, like hiding subtotals is not so easy to discover.  In today's video, I will show you 20 things you can do on the matrix that will take that visualization to the next level.  Did I miss any? Let me know

value.title: Power BI Slicers vs Filters - which will you choose?
value.excerpt: Adam picks up on David Eldersveld's blog about Power BI slicers versus filters and looks at if slicers are even needed now. The filter pane can satisfy a majority of scenarios. There are a few that it can't. Which Power BI feature will you choose?  David Eldersveld blog - https://dataveld.com/2019/01/18/are-power-bi-slicers-still-relevant-with-the-new-filter-pane/

value.title: Building relationships between tables when both have duplicates
value.excerpt: PowerPivot and Power BI Desktop only allow the creation of relationships between tables when one of columns forming the relationship does not have duplicate values.  In order to relate these two tables to one another, what we need is a third table with all distinct values from both tables. In this tutorial
